snippet: Steve Coburn returned to ABC’s “Good Morning America” on Monday to apologize for remarks that diminished the achievement of Tonalist, the Belmont Stakes winner.
abstract: California Chrome co-owner Steve Coburn apologizes to those affiliated with Belmont Stakes winner Tonalist and to the horse racing world, two days after a nationally televised outburst about how fresh horses had deprived horse racing of a Triple Crown champion.
lead_paragraph: Steve Coburn returned to ABC’s “Good Morning America” on Monday to apologize for remarks that diminished the achievement of Tonalist, the Belmont Stakes winner.

headline.main: California Chrome’s Co-Owner Apologizes for His Outbursts
headline.print_headline: California Chrome’s Co-Owner Apologizes for His Outbursts
